Source code for blend.galaxy.users

"""
Manipulate Galaxy users
These methods must be done by a registered Galaxy administrator user.
"""
import requests
import simplejson


[docs]class UserClient(object):
    def __init__(self, galaxy_instance):
        self.gi = galaxy_instance
        self.module = 'users'
        self.url = '/'.join([self.gi.url, self.module])


[docs]    def get_users(self, deleted=False):
        """
        Get a list of all registered users

        :rtype: list
        :return: A list of dicts with user details. For example:``

           |[{u'email': u'a_user@example.com',
           |  u'id': u'dda47097d9189f15',
           |  u'url': u'/api/users/dda47097d9189f15'}]``

        """
        url = self.gi._make_url(self, deleted=deleted)
        r = self.gi.make_get_request(url)
        return r.json



[docs]    def show_user(self, user_id, deleted=False):
        """
        Display information about a user
        """
        url = self.gi._make_url(self, module_id=user_id, deleted=deleted)
        r = self.gi.make_get_request(url)
        return r.json



[docs]    def create_user(self, user_email):
        """
        Create a new Galaxy user
        Note that for this method to work, the Galaxy instance must have 
        ``allow_user_creation`` and ``use_remote_user`` options set to ``True``
        in the universe_wsgi.ini configuration file.
        """
        payload = {}
        payload['remote_user_email'] = user_email
        payload = simplejson.dumps(payload)
        url = self.gi._make_url(self)
        r = self.gi.make_post_request(url, payload)
        return r.json
